project.teaser: The overarching goals of NET4Air are: (i) to significantly advance excellence capacity and resources in IMT with a view of addressing the research and innovation gap and imbalance within Europe; (ii) to broadly increase IMT expertise, know-how and attractiveness in innovative...
project.objective: The overarching goals of NET4Air are: (i) to significantly advance excellence capacity and resources in IMT with a view of addressing the research and innovation gap and imbalance within Europe; (ii) to broadly increase IMT expertise, know-how and attractiveness in innovative nanotechnologies, materials, devices, smart systems, data analytics and best-practices for environment monitoring, (iii) to bring the IMT research, education and technology capacity to the new stage of Open Science, by enlarging its European partnership and by establishing a collaborative program with state representatives, local agencies, research centres, universities, industry and citizen associations, (iv) to foster regional excellence in devices and practices for air quality monitoring (v) to engage Romanian citizens in a participatory approach to air quality science and (vi) to apply European Green Deal principles for saving our environment and contribute to citizens health, wellbeing and prosperity. These goals will be translated in concrete actions using the specific Twinning Coordination & Support activities articulated in seven Work Packages. A plethora of activities such as training, staff exchanges, events attendance and organisation, and a Networking Centre for Excellence in environmental monitoring and remediation will be implemented to support NET4Air activities and to foster regional excellence in the field of air monitoring. An exploratory research project aiming to develop a low cost wearable/portable nanoelectonic based platform for air monitoring, demonstrated in four use cases will significantly contribute to societal, economic and environmental impact of NET4Air. A new department for research management and administration at IMT will enhance its capacity to initiate and join EU project and initiatives. The gender equality, diversity and inclusion strategy will be carefully implemented including hiring people for new jobs created in the project and beyond.
project.title: NETWORKING CENTER FOR EXCELLENCE IN NANOELECTRONIC DEVICES FOR AIR MONITORING
project.keywords: sensors, system integration, air monitoring and remediation, nanotechnology

article.title: Achieving EU excellence in air monitoring solutions

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe‚Äôs financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‚ÄòDigital transition‚Äô).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe‚Äôs financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe‚Äôs financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe‚Äôs financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe‚Äôs financial contribution to Europe‚Äôs biodiversity‚Äôs path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
